oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Nashville Record Review Artist Interviews # 3
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recordings of phone interviews with various artists hosted by Al Rosen. Recording features: Sylvia, Gary Morris, David Allan Coe, Sonny James, and Mickey Gilley. Item is listed as part 3 of the Nashville Radio Review artist interviews.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Al Risen
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Al Risen introduces Sylvia who discusses her upcoming touring schedule -- (00:34) Risen inquires about how much Sylvia continues to paint -- (01:10) Sylvia discusses her excitement for "Snapshot" -- (01:51) Risen and Sylvia discuss how Sylvia keeps her figure while on the road -- (02:30) Sylvia reflects on "Nobody" being the only album to go gold, out of Nashville, in 1982 -- (02:50) Risen radio spot introducing "Nobody" -- (02:53) Risen discusses the editing required to Skip Woolwine and Sylvia -- (03:07) Risen inquires about whether or not Sylvia gets tired of performing "Nobody" -- (03:26) Risen reveals that "Nobody" was the only album to go gold out of Nashville in 1982 -- (03:50) "Snapshot" is told by Sylvia to be a cute song with a story, and Risen thanks RCA Records -- (04:18) Risen radio spot introducing "Snapshot" -- (04:23) Risen introduces Gary Morris who reveals he is about to work Nashville After Hours -- (04:55) Morris reveals he had been traveling abroad for shows -- (05:55) Risen inquires about Morris' upcoming schedule, and Morris reveals a packed schedule -- (06:36) "The Love She Found in Me" is discussed by Morris and Risen -- (07:20) Morris reflects on the amount of recording material he is sent -- (08:13) Risen radio spot introducing "The Love She Found in Me" -- (08:18) Risen introduces David Allan Coe, and Coe reflects on his tour -- (09:35) Coe discusses the Ruskin Cave -- (09:57) Risen introduces "The Ride," and Coe reveals a story about Hank Williams and the Grand Ole Opry -- (10:44) Risen radio spot introduction of "The Ride" -- (10:49) Risen introduces Sonny James and both discuss James' time in Hawaii -- (12:16) James reflects on what he enjoys doing in his free time -- (13:08) James discusses the amount of time he has planned to tour -- (13:31) Risen introduces "The Fool in Me," and James discusses crafting the arrangement for the record -- (14:44) Risen radio spot introduction of "The Fool in Me" -- (14:49) Risen introduces Mickey Gilley and both discuss Gilley's acting role -- (15:50) Risen inquires about how Gilley and Johnny Lee were no longer performing together, and Gilley tells that it was time for them to do different shows -- (16:55) Risen inquires about Jerry Lee, and Gilley discusses the difficulty of working with Lee -- (17:27) Risen introduces "Talk to Me," and Gilley gives credit to Jim Ed Norman -- (18:00) Risen radio spot introducing "Talk to Me"
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Risen, Al; Sylvia, 1956-; Morris, Gary; Coe, David Allan; James, Sonny; Gilley, Mickey;
